intro: Ampelocissus butoensis, commonly known as the Butoensis grape ivy, is a climbing plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by red, fleshy berries. It is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and ability to climb walls or trellises. The berries are edible but not commonly consumed by humans.
